item.title: When Terence Stamp, Bad Boy of ‘60s Cinema, Left Acting for an Ashram
item.description: After a decade away from the movies, he had a remarkable second act.

item.title: The Track and Field Star Who Casually Shattered Race and Gender Barriers
item.description: Mabel Landry Staton was one of the first Black, female long-jumpers in the history of the Olympics.

item.title: The Hip-Hop Trailblazer Who Demanded Recognition — and Pay — for Her Work
item.description: Angie Stone always knew she had what it took to make it, even if the music industry did not.

item.title: The Activist Who Became Radicalized by Working on ‘Our Bodies, Our Selves’
item.description: Norma Swenson exposed the systematic sexism within the medical establishment.

item.title: There Was No Villain Michelle Trachtenberg Couldn’t Play
item.description: The actress seemed to channel her childhood bullies when playing deliciously vindictive characters.

item.title: D’Wayne Wiggins’s Songs Were Embraced by Everyone From Church Ladies to Biggie
item.description: With Tony! Toni! Toné!, his songs captured the mood of how people lived and died in Oakland.

item.title: Why Do Movies Keep Repeating the Same Joke About the Afterlife?
item.description: From the recent ‘Eternity’ to classics like ‘Defending Your Life’ and ‘Beetlejuice,’ the gag remains the same: What if the next world worked just like this one?

item.title: Can You Let Your Dog Run Off-Leash Wherever You Want?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over the use of shared spaces.

item.title: Beloved Objects Left Behind by Val Kilmer, Ozzy Osbourne and Others We Lost This Year
item.description: Metal crosses, a recliner, a blue wedding suit: the most cherished belongings of Ozzy Osbourne, Brian Wilson, Kitty Dukakis and others.

item.title: How ‘Affordability’ Became a New Magic Word for Politicians
item.description: A rallying cry for Democrats taps into frustration over the inaccessibility of a modestly nice American existence — even for those with a decent income.

item.title: My Ex-Lover Lied About His Marriage Being Over. Should I Tell His Wife?
item.description: I started feeling I wasn’t getting the full story. My instincts were correct.

item.title: The Lives They Lived
item.description: Remembering some of the artists, innovators and thinkers we lost in the past year.
